title: BHP files 2025 annual report with SEC By Investing
description: BHP files 2025 annual report with SEC
content:
MELBOURNE - giant BHP Group (NYSE: ) Limited announced on Friday it has filed its 2025 US Annual Report (Form 20-F) with the United States Securities and Exchange Commission.

The company noted in a press release that the Form 20-F was prepared in accordance with SEC requirements and not for reporting under the Australasian Code for Reporting of Exploration Results, Mineral Resources and Ore Reserves (JORC Code, 2012 Edition).

BHP has submitted the report to the UK’s Financial Conduct Authority National Storage Mechanism, where it will be available for inspection. The document can also be accessed through BHP’s website or the SEC’s website.

American Depositary Receipt holders can request a hard copy of the company’s complete audited financial statements at no cost by contacting Citibank Shareholder Services.

The filing represents a routine annual disclosure requirement for BHP, which maintains listings on multiple global exchanges. The company, headquartered in Australia, is one of the world’s largest mining corporations with operations spanning multiple continents.

No specific financial highlights or operational updates were included in the announcement about the filing.

This article was generated with the support of AI and reviewed by an editor. For more information see our T&C.
summary: BHP Group (NYSE: ) Limited has filed its 2025 US Annual Report (Form 20-F) with the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and will be available for inspection in the UK's Financial Conduct Authority National Storage Mechanism. The filing is part of a routine annual disclosure requirement for the company, which maintains listings on multiple global exchanges.
shortSummary: BHP Group has filed its 2025 US Annual Report with the SEC, focusing on compliance with regulatory requirements and operational readiness.

argos_summary: BHP Group Limited has filed its 2025 US Annual Report (Form 20-F) with the SEC, complying with regulatory requirements. The report is available for inspection through the UK’s Financial Conduct Authority and on BHP’s website. This filing is part of BHP's routine annual disclosure process, and no specific financial or operational updates were provided in the announcement.
